g.text: Chapter 4 Strengthening and Implementing the Global Response
4.SM.4 Guidance and Assessment for Feasibility Assessment
4.SM.4.1 Guidance for Feasibility Assessment as presented in Section 4.5.1
Guidance for conducting the feasibility assessment of mitigation and adaptation options. See 4.SM.4.2 for the assessment and literature basis of the
assessment of mitigation options and 4.SM.4.3 for the assessment and literature basis of adaptation options.
Parameters used for the calculation of the overall feasibility of the dimension-option combinations.
Guidance for Conducting the Feasibility Assessment of Mitigation and Adaptation Options
NA (not applicable) The indicator is not relevant to the option
• No peer-reviewed literature could be located supporting an assessment of whether this indicator would limit the option’s feasibility
• The peer-reviewed literature that mentions the issue is not robust enough
• One or two papers make statements/present research that could be a basis for the assessment, but this evidence is considered too limited
• Two or more papers provide a basis for the assessment as a side issue in the paper, not as a core issue
A A feasibility assessment can be made:
• If there are one or two robust papers (or more) that contain references
• If one or a number of meta-studies and reviews provide extensive
A = The indicator could block the feasibility of this option
B = The indicator does not have a positive nor a negative effect on the
C C = The indicator does not pose any barrier to the feasibility of this option
Number of indicators used to assess the overall feasibility of a dimension, typically two to five
Number of indicators that are not applicable (NA) to the option
Total number of indicators for which there is no evidence (NE) or limited evidence (LE)
Number of indicators assessed as A
Number of indicators assessed as B
Number of indicators assessed as C
Legend criteria for the overall feasibility of the dimension-option combinations as shown in Table 4.11 for mitigation options and Table 4.12 for
Legend Criteria for the Overall Feasibility of each of the Dimension-Option Combinations
